bropals.lib.simplegame.gui

Class GuiButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.gui.GuiElement
      • bropals.lib.simplegame.gui.GuiButton

  • public class GuiButton
extends GuiElement
    Represents a GUI button.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a new GuiButton by specifying its position, size, image data, and press response.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiButton

        public GuiButton(int x,
         int y,
         int w,
         int h,
         java.awt.image.BufferedImage down,
         java.awt.image.BufferedImage up,
         java.awt.image.BufferedImage hover,
         GuiButtonAction guiButtonAction)
        Creates a new GuiButton by specifying its position, size, image data, and press response.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position.
        y - the y position.
        w - the width.
        h - the height.
        down - the image to show when the button is pressed.
        up - the image to show when the button is not being hovered over.
        hover - the image to show when the button is being hovered over.
        guiButtonAction - the method to call when this button is pressed.

    • Method Detail

      • setDownTime

        public void setDownTime(int downTime)
        Sets the number of frames the button is shown in the down state after being pressed.
        Parameters:
        downTime - the number of the frames the button is down.

        Updates the GUI element. This method does not need to call super()

        Parameters:
        mouseX - the current x position of the mouse
